subject: Restrict users from downloading protected image
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9303, 'name': 'Abhishek Kekane', 'email': 'akekane@redhat.com', 'username': 'abhishekkekane'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-20 21:58:39.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/image_data.py', 'glance/api/middleware/cache.py', 'glance/tests/etc/property-protections-policies.conf', 'glance/tests/unit/common/test_property_utils.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_cache_middleware.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/common/property_utils.py', 'glance/api/v1/images.py', 'glance/tests/etc/property-protections.conf'], 'message': 'Restrict users from downloading protected image

Added download operation to the protected properties.

For example,
[^x_billing_code_ntt_xyz.*]
create = admin,owner
read = admin,Member,_member_
update = admin,owner
delete = admin,owner
download= admin,owner

Currently, property protection is defined only for Create, Read, Update
and Delete (CRUD) operations. In addition to this Download operation need
to be added in order to restrict downloading image having protected
properties.

Modified v1 and v2 api to add download restriction.
Modified logic of caching to restrict download for v1 and v2 api.

To use this feature, intended user need to deploy two glance-api services
with common glanc registry and backend.
One api would be specific to nova where user will configure policy to allow
any user to download the image whereas in another set, it will restrict user
from downloading the image if you have enabled protected properties policy.

DocImpact: Need to modify following options in glance-api.conf file to enable
property-protections:

property_protection_file = property-protections-roles.conf
property_protection_rule_format = roles

Deployer need to create or modify "property-protections-roles.conf" as per
requirement to define accessible roles for protected property.

Change-Id: I4e10871832eb84ef91c3585ef8f7b61f38040b53
blueprint: restrict-downloading-images-protected-properties
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Restrict users from downloading protected image

Added download operation to the protected properties.

For example,
[^x_billing_code_ntt_xyz.*]
create = admin,owner
read = admin,Member,_member_
update = admin,owner
delete = admin,owner
download= admin,owner

Currently, property protection is defined only for Create, Read, Update
and Delete (CRUD) operations. In addition to this Download operation need
to be added in order to restrict downloading image having protected
properties.

Modified v1 and v2 api to add download restriction.
Modified logic of caching to restrict download for v1 and v2 api.

To use this feature, intended user need to deploy two glance-api services
with common glanc registry and backend.
One api would be specific to nova where user will configure policy to allow
any user to download the image whereas in another set, it will restrict user
from downloading the image if you have enabled protected properties policy.

DocImpact: Need to modify following options in glance-api.conf file to enable
property-protections:

property_protection_file = property-protections-roles.conf
property_protection_rule_format = roles

Deployer need to create or modify "property-protections-roles.conf" as per
requirement to define accessible roles for protected property.

Change-Id: I4e10871832eb84ef91c3585ef8f7b61f38040b53
blueprint: restrict-downloading-images-protected-properties

Ability to completely deny an update to a resource's property
is present in AWS but is missing from Heat.

subject: Neutronv2 api does not support neutron without port quota
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-01 17:31:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'message': 'Neutronv2 api does not support neutron without port quota

If quota on ports are disabled in neutron (see below), neutronv2 api
set port quota to None and quota check raises a TypeError.

  # neutron server /etc/neutron/neutron.conf
  [quotas]
  quota_items=network,subnet,router,floatingip

This change set port quota to -1 (unlimited) if quota on ports are
disabled.

Change-Id: I89c530dd57a7beb35695be124ca8511148378458
Closes-Bug: #1333315
(cherry picked from commit 04add2ed0d8b0341ea347ac98834f75cf5b2be1d)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Neutronv2 api does not support neutron without port quota

If quota on ports are disabled in neutron (see below), neutronv2 api
set port quota to None and quota check raises a TypeError.

  # neutron server /etc/neutron/neutron.conf
  [quotas]
  quota_items=network,subnet,router,floatingip

This change set port quota to -1 (unlimited) if quota on ports are
disabled.

Change-Id: I89c530dd57a7beb35695be124ca8511148378458
Closes-Bug: #1333315
(cherry picked from commit 04add2ed0d8b0341ea347ac98834f75cf5b2be1d)

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use keystone.host in stackrc

/root/stackrc has a hardcoded value of localhost for OS_AUTH_URL,
which doesn't help when we can't talk to it due to VIP changes. Set
it to keystone.host.

Change-Id: If952f383e8970e3298c36cdd750f6c6a20209e81

commit_message:
Support dpdkvhost in LibvirtGenericVIFDriver

Propose to extend LibvirtGenericVIFDriver class to support
dpdkvhost. This will allow Openvswitch derivatives that
use Intel(R) DPDK to be used with Openstack.

Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt-ovs-use-usvhost

Change-Id: Ibcf7d5354e39fa3ad4d021acff8d3e3e50c0900d

commit_message:
VMware: use default values in get_info() when properties are missing

The properties that we retrieve from VirtualMachineConfigSummary are
optional ('summary.config.numCpu', 'summary.config.memorySizeMB') and
if they are missing we should return default values from get_info()

This patch also improves the unit test for get_info(). It removes the
test in test_driver_api.py (test_get_info() and test_spawn() are the
same) and adds a new test in test_vmops.py

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py
	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py

Closes-Bug: 1317912
Change-Id: Ibbb28985d13de371fdac8a119ad820d25acc21be
(cherry picked from commit 2db7528ca258d7b0c1205ab2f9a76569d9f9a82d)

commit_message:
controller0AllNodesConfig to controller0AllNodes.

Rename all occurrences of controller0AllNodesConfig to
controller0AllNodes as this is in line with compute node
deployments. Also the current naming is confusing as this is a
deployment step not a configuration step.

Change-Id: I8efa3b6a64a099e1e8ee43009472152aed5f8ad8

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 860, 'name': 'Donagh McCabe', 'email': 'donagh.mccabe@hpe.com', 'username': 'donagh-mccabe'}, {'_account_id': 1253, 'name': 'Gerry Drudy', 'email': 'gerry.drudy@hpe.com', 'username': 'gerry-drudy'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 4330, 'name': 'Tomas Sedovic', 'email': 'tsedovic@redhat.com', 'username': 'tomas-8c8'}, {'_account_id': 6449, 'name': 'Chris Jones', 'email': 'cmsj@tenshu.net', 'username': 'cmsj'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8399, 'name': 'Jay Dobies', 'email': 'jason.dobies@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdob'}, {'_account_id': 8688, 'name': 'Alexis Lee', 'email': 'openstack@lxsli.co.uk', 'username': 'lxsli'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-05-01 09:04:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Move swift logs from /var/log/syslog into their own log files

Swift uses syslog to handle all of its logging needs. By default swift
logs are added to /var/log/syslog. This can add quite a bit of clutter
to this log file and makes it more difficult to debug swift issues.

This change locates swift logs as follows:

/mnt/state/var/log/swift/proxy.log
    Contains all logs from proxy server
/mnt/state/var/log/swift/server.log
    Contains all logs from account, container & object servers
/mnt/state/var/log/swift/background.log
    Contains all logs from daemons such as replicators, auditors, updaters
    and reaper.

This change also enables proxy server logging i.e. add proxy-logging (x2) to
the proxy server pipeline and includes the proxy-logging filter to
proxy-server.conf.

This change also sets reveal_sensitive_prefix config option so only 18 chars
of the X-Auth-Token are displayed in the proxy server log messages to avoid
revealing this sensitive data and to avoid clutter in the log (X-Auth-Token is
large).

Change-Id: I80ce0ae002eb58b420bddc253ca186d2147c2000

A symbolic link is created between /mnt/state/var/log/swift and

commit_message:
Add proxy-logging to proxy-server pipeline

This change enables proxy server logging i.e. add proxy-logging
(x2) to the proxy server pipeline and includes the proxy-logging filter
to proxy-server.conf.

commit_message:
Logging audit for trove/guestagent/backup module

Adjust logging to conform to logging standards.
Cleaned up some messages that were unclear. Also
corrected the usage of the word Backup which was
inconsistently capitalized in some messages.

Also addressed a pattern of exception handlers using
LOG.error merely to log the exception (instead of
using LOG.exception)

Change-Id: Id2eb57d3395273f9aebd41de0146f7a2fc2774c8
Partial-Bug: #1324206

commit_message:
Fix security group list when not defined for an instance

If an instance has an empty security group list an exception
is thrown due to iteration attempt of None.

To fix this, this patch modifies get_instance_security_group
to return an empty list instead of None.

Change-Id: I7efb3c3a58d7e20501d126c6d194479ca1d14166
Closes-Bug: #1291489
(cherry picked from commit c32986966dfd034c3d706b2e9ab2820a2c3cfc3e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-19 22:08:02.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Add support for os_region_name

For environments with multiple endpoints due to regions, tasks such as

Change-Id: I5cc41385741054281dafb501742a0d7b26099f88
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add support for os_region_name

For environments with multiple endpoints due to regions, tasks such as
cinder volume attach will not work unless os_region_name is set. This
allows the os_region_name to be passed in.

Change-Id: I5cc41385741054281dafb501742a0d7b26099f88

commit_message:
Do not schedule network when creating reserved DHCP port

If device_id is DEVICE_ID_RESERVED_DHCP_PORT, do not schedule
network nor notify to dhcp-agent.

Closes-Bug: #1327000
Change-Id: Idf88767596bf0fc31bf856a423d35cb1575b57f3

subject: assertTrue/False should have msg param
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-21 12:51:46.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/hacking/checks.py'], 'message': "assertTrue/False should have msg param

assertTrue / False should really have a msg param. Otherwise we
get the extremely descriptive True != False when the test fails.
Some times, that's ok.

But in the base case it's not. This doesn't yet fix any of the
issues, but is posted for consideration about whether we think
this would be helpful.

Change-Id: Ib002564f54a0a6ae390a70908549fb5fc5a84372
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
assertTrue/False should have msg param

assertTrue / False should really have a msg param. Otherwise we
get the extremely descriptive True != False when the test fails.
Some times, that's ok.

But in the base case it's not. This doesn't yet fix any of the
issues, but is posted for consideration about whether we think
this would be helpful.

Change-Id: Ib002564f54a0a6ae390a70908549fb5fc5a84372

commit_message:
Switch to Horizon 2014.2.b2

There was a change merged to Horizon master a few days ago that upgrades
Twitter Bootstrap from version 2.x to version 3.x. There are lots changes
in the version upgrade that affect both CSS and JS.

commit_message:
versions API: ignore request with a body

Update the OS API versions controller so it ignores requests
with a body. Previously an incoming (unauthenticated)
request to the versions API would log a TypeError trace
in the nova-api.log file with the following message:

TypeError: index() got an unexpected keyword argument 'body'

Change-Id: Icc3ccfc537b13627b8d5ba43ae3ba91e34e08c9e
Closes-bug: #1306727

subject: libvirt: Refresh volume connection_info after volume snapshot
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8247, 'name': 'Thang Pham', 'email': 'thang.g.pham@gmail.com', 'username': 'thang.pham'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-05 21:19:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Refresh volume connection_info after volume snapshot

The following patch is related to the guest assisted snapshot
functionality.  When you take a snapshot of a volume
(e.g. GlusterFS) attached to a running instance, a new snapshot
file is created, i.e. volume-<uuid>.<snapshot-uuid>.  The
instance uses this file as the active volume.  If you shutdown
and restart the instance, nova will reattach the base volume
(volume-<uuid>) to the instance instead of the snapshot volume
(volume-<uuid>.<snapshot-uuid>).  The expected behavior is to
have the snapshot volume reattach to the instance.  This is
caused by stale data being returned from the database when
_get_instance_volume_block_device_info is called during
_power_on.  To fix this bug, this patch calls
refresh_connection_info to update the database in both
volume_snapshot_create and _volume_snapshot_delete methods of the
libvirt driver.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py

Change-Id: I0f340a3f879580e7981d97863bc299e33d71aa84
Closes-Bug: #1304695
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Refresh volume connection_info after volume snapshot

The following patch is related to the guest assisted snapshot
functionality.  When you take a snapshot of a volume
(e.g. GlusterFS) attached to a running instance, a new snapshot
file is created, i.e. volume-<uuid>.<snapshot-uuid>.  The
instance uses this file as the active volume.  If you shutdown
and restart the instance, nova will reattach the base volume
(volume-<uuid>) to the instance instead of the snapshot volume
(volume-<uuid>.<snapshot-uuid>).  The expected behavior is to
have the snapshot volume reattach to the instance.  This is
caused by stale data being returned from the database when
_get_instance_volume_block_device_info is called during
_power_on.  To fix this bug, this patch calls
refresh_connection_info to update the database in both
volume_snapshot_create and _volume_snapshot_delete methods of the
libvirt driver.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py

Change-Id: I0f340a3f879580e7981d97863bc299e33d71aa84
Closes-Bug: #1304695

commit_message:
Moving eventlet.hubs.use_hub call up

Under the design concept of eventlet, we need to call
eventlet.hubs.use_hub() before the application starts
doing any I/O. And it makes custom log handlers register
correct event listeners.

Closes-bug: 1247889
Change-Id: I3d43021c8cb6ed630123781f3686d62e5159edfc
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-02 17:06:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/volumeutilsv2.py', 'nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_hypervapi.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/volumeutils.py', 'nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_volumeutils.py', 'nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_volumeutilsv2.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/volumeops.py'], 'message': 'Fixes Hyper-V iSCSI target login method

Hyper-V is trying to log in to portals/targets every time a volume
is attached, even if the portal/target was already connected. This
is not an issue with most volume backends, but it causes the attach
to fail when using Storwize as a Cinder backend.

This patch fixes the issue by checking if the target or portal is
already connected, and simply perform an update in this case,
instead of attempting to create a new connection.

Also, a retry loop is introduced for the case when the iSCSI target
login fails. As in this loop it is checked whether or not the
operation completed successfully, this method does not rely anymore
only on a sleep interval to ensure that the connection to the target
has been made. Even so, on V2 volume utilities, the sleep interval
is still needed to avoid having a new connection attempt before the
last one finished.

The method which gets the according mounted disk must raise an
exception when the device number is -1, which signifies that the
disk has not been mounted properly.

Co-Authored-By: Jay Bryant <jsbryant@us.ibm.com>

Closes-bug: #1221525

Change-Id: I92d2a586704fa3e857f46432bb571c81e86d183b
(cherry picked from commit ea91ad2b2317cb88fb14c0cdaf31187eca93ff57)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V iSCSI target login method

Hyper-V is trying to log in to portals/targets every time a volume
is attached, even if the portal/target was already connected. This
is not an issue with most volume backends, but it causes the attach
to fail when using Storwize as a Cinder backend.

This patch fixes the issue by checking if the target or portal is
already connected, and simply perform an update in this case,
instead of attempting to create a new connection.

Also, a retry loop is introduced for the case when the iSCSI target
login fails. As in this loop it is checked whether or not the
operation completed successfully, this method does not rely anymore
only on a sleep interval to ensure that the connection to the target
has been made. Even so, on V2 volume utilities, the sleep interval
is still needed to avoid having a new connection attempt before the
last one finished.

The method which gets the according mounted disk must raise an
exception when the device number is -1, which signifies that the
disk has not been mounted properly.

Co-Authored-By: Jay Bryant <jsbryant@us.ibm.com>

Closes-bug: #1221525

Change-Id: I92d2a586704fa3e857f46432bb571c81e86d183b
(cherry picked from commit ea91ad2b2317cb88fb14c0cdaf31187eca93ff57)

commit_message:
Don't specify admin_token in paste config

This is not a value that is going to be useful on other systems and
shouldn't be included in the default or test pipelines.

The two similar commits were squashed together here.

(cherry picked from commit ae696056fbac7d74a395710934950e0013cd4d37)
(cherry picked from commit 9db80e79ea3e687000121729648af7e79b7b2d78)

Closes-Bug: #1299332
Change-Id: I714539b7536965fa08a3ddc64493b481df7397e3

commit_message:
Check rescue_server action attributes of Nova APIs

This patch adds the JSON schema for Nova V2 & V3 rescue server
action APIs response and validate the response with added JSON schema
to block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

For V3 API, "admin_password" in response body is depend on config
variable "enable_instance_password". So schema and request
is adjusted accordingly.
NOTE - V2 rescue API's response does not on above config variable.

The response body of rescue server V2 APIs is below:
{
    "adminPass": "%(password)s"
}

The response body of rescue server V3 APIs is below:
If CONF.enable_instance_password is true-
{
    "admin_password": "%(password)s"
}
Else
    {}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I85f18eaa58bfef1871100816f97487f9fa9bc0ee

commit_message:
Use None instead of mutables in test method params defaults

Mutables in the method params defaults might cause errors and
that's why it's anti-pattern in most of the cases and should be
removed.

Change-Id: Ie9897aae6e95962e0991ac9d9fc5c175f2da12a4

commit_message:
Add context as param to cleanup function

In nova-network, when we start
to cleanup the stuffs it did when handle exception
but the function is following in objects/fixed_ips.py
def disassociate(self, context):
so the context param is lost and it can lead to problem.

Change-Id: I66a1681f47fc69bf0fd92137ee27481659833bef
Closes-Bug: #1350268

commit_message:
Make Ironic the default and deprecate nova-bm

nova-baremetal has been deprecated by Nova and slated for removal.
The least we can do is be aligned with this!

Change-Id: Icb66ebe3237e47dfe5eb7967e64c67bdaa7eac51

commit_message:
Add logstash-web element

Configures logstash-web to start as a service. The upstream init script
has an error around CONF_DIR, which is unused anyway, so that has been
fixed. Additionally the http port has been changed to 19292 so as not to
conflict with Glance.

Advances blueprint logstash.

Change-Id: I4d552aab27fe9afab43c01364fad9d816c86ea1f

commit_message:
Data Processing: Allowing for HDFS data sources without hdfs://

Now that HDFS data sources can be either full URLs
or paths relative to the cluster itself, it is no
longer desirable to force "hdfs://" at the start
of hdfs data sources.
* No longer force the prefix on the create form
* For swift, we now check to see that the location
  starts with swift://, if it doesn't we add it

Change-Id: I62a8fbad6d55505c2b82561fe3de706e5069c83f
Closes-Bug:  bug #1336283

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-01 12:11:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Avoid errors in log when neutron tests are skipped

The BaseNetworkTest class setUp() method will initialize
various class attributes which the tearDown() method
expects to exist. Unfortunately when Neutron is not
available, the entire of the setUp() method is skipped,
but tearDown() still runs. This causes the logs to get
polluted with errors about missing attributes during
tearDown(). eg

ERROR tempest.test [-] tearDownClass failed: type object
 'DHCPAgentSchedulersTestJSON' has no attribute 'ipsecpolicies'
TRACE tempest.test     for ipsecpolicy in cls.ipsecpolicies:

Move the check for Neutron to the end of the setUp()
method so all attributes are initialized first.

Change-Id: I042ca5c47e5c1e8d1042754fd7f36036a40b2f03
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-07-03 11:38:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Avoid errors in log when neutron tests are skipped

 'DHCPAgentSchedulersTestJSON' has no attribute 'ipsecpolicies'
TRACE tempest.test     for ipsecpolicy in cls.ipsecpolicies:

Move the check for Neutron to the end of the setUpClass()
method so all attributes are initialized first.

Change-Id: I042ca5c47e5c1e8d1042754fd7f36036a40b2f03
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

various class attributes which the tearDownClass() method
expects to exist. Unfortunately when Neutron is not
available, the entire of the setUpClass() method is skipped,
but tearDownClass() still runs. This causes the logs to get
polluted with errors about missing attributes during
tearDownClass(). eg

ERROR tempest.test [-] tearDownClass failed: type object
 'DHCPAgentSchedulersTestJSON' has no attribute 'ipsecpolicies'
TRACE tempest.test     for ipsecpolicy in cls.ipsecpolicies:

commit_message:
Avoid errors in log when neutron tests are skipped

The BaseNetworkTest class setUpClass() method will initialize
various class attributes which the tearDownClass() method
expects to exist. Unfortunately when Neutron is not
available, the entire of the setUpClass() method is skipped,
but tearDownClass() still runs. This causes the logs to get
polluted with errors about missing attributes during
tearDownClass(). eg

ERROR tempest.test [-] tearDownClass failed: type object
 'DHCPAgentSchedulersTestJSON' has no attribute 'ipsecpolicies'
TRACE tempest.test     for ipsecpolicy in cls.ipsecpolicies:

Make the tearDownClass() code be conditional on neutron
being enabled too.

Change-Id: I042ca5c47e5c1e8d1042754fd7f36036a40b2f03
